metadata.header_path: /FORM 10-K/Part II/Item 8 - Financial Statements and Supplementary Data/NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS/Note 1 â€” DESCRIPTION OF BUSINESS, ACCOUNTING POLICIES, AND SUPPLEMENTAL DISCLOSURES/
aws::graph::propositions: Amazon Digital Content Licensing Accounting Practices
Amazon obtains video content through licensing agreements.
Amazon obtains episodic television through licensing agreements.
Amazon obtains movies through licensing agreements.
Amazon obtains music content through licensing agreements.
Licensing agreements have a wide range of licensing provisions.
Licensing provisions include fixed payment schedules.
Licensing provisions include variable payment schedules.
Amazon recognizes an asset when the license fee for a specific video title is determinable.
Amazon recognizes an asset when the license fee for a specific video title is reasonably estimable.
Amazon recognizes an asset when the license fee for a specific music title is determinable.
Amazon recognizes an asset when the license fee for a specific music title is reasonably estimable.
Amazon recognizes an asset when the content is available to Amazon.
Amazon recognizes a corresponding liability for the amounts owed when recognizing an asset.
Amazon reduces the liability as payments are made.
Amazon amortizes the asset to "Cost of sales" on an accelerated basis.
The accelerated basis is based on estimated usage patterns.
The accelerated basis is based on viewing patterns.
Amazon may amortize the asset to "Cost of sales" on a straight-line basis.
If the licensing fee is not determinable, no asset is recorded.
If the licensing fee is not reasonably estimable, no asset is recorded.
If the licensing fee is not determinable, no liability is recorded.
If the licensing fee is not reasonably estimable, no liability is recorded.
If the licensing fee is not determinable, licensing costs are expensed as incurred.
If the licensing fee is not reasonably estimable, licensing costs are expensed as incurred.

/FORM 10-K/Part II/Item 8 - Financial Statements and Supplementary Data/NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS/Note 1 â€” DESCRIPTION OF BUSINESS, ACCOUNTING POLICIES, AND SUPPLEMENTAL DISCLOSURES/

text:
###### Digital Video and Music Content

We obtain video content, inclusive of episodic television and movies, and music content for customers through licensing agreements that have a wide range of licensing provisions including both fixed and variable payment schedules. When the license fee for a specific video or music title is determinable or reasonably estimable and the content is available to us, we recognize an asset and a corresponding liability for the amounts owed. We reduce the liability as payments are made and we amortize the asset to â€œCost of salesâ€ on an accelerated basis, based on estimated usage or viewing patterns, or on a straight-line basis. If the licensing fee is not determinable or reasonably estimable, no asset or liability is recorded and licensing costs are expensed as incurred.
